title: Integrate uploaded images and elevate UI elegance across the app

requirements.text: Add the 14 user-uploaded image files to the frontend as static assets and standardize how they are referenced in the React UI (no backend image serving). Uploaded files: f25340160.jpeg, f25339648.jpeg, f5418752.jpeg, f25481216.jpeg, f25737216.jpeg, AI automation.png, discover & strategy.jpeg, DM ICON.png, f25741568.jpeg, deployment icon.png, f25737984.jpeg, f25726208.jpeg, f25639680.jpeg, f25731584.jpeg.

quotes: use this images & make this more elegant

acceptanceCriteria: All 14 uploaded images are present in the frontend static assets directory and load correctly in production build (no broken links in the UI).
No API/backend changes are required to display these images; they are loaded via static paths.
Images are referenced via a single, consistent mapping (e.g., a small constants module) rather than scattered hardcoded paths across many components.

requirements.text: Incorporate the uploaded images into the UI in a cohesive way that improves perceived quality: use the icon-style images for platform affordances (Instagram/WhatsApp/Email/DM/Phone/Deployment/Automation), and use the illustration-style images as page hero/empty-state artwork where appropriate (e.g., Dashboard empty state, Planner introduction card, Outreach empty state cards).

quotes: use this images & make this more elegant

acceptanceCriteria: At least one primary page (Dashboard) and at least two secondary pages (e.g., Planner and Outreach) visually incorporate the uploaded images in a way that is responsive and does not overflow on mobile.
Platform-related visuals in Outreach use the uploaded platform/icon images in tabs and/or empty states while keeping existing labels in English and maintaining usability/contrast.

Existing generated assets currently used (e.g., quickbee-app-icon, empty-state-dashboard) remain functional; if replaced, replacements must be from the uploaded images and must not degrade layout or readability.

requirements.text: Refine the overall visual styling to be “more elegant” while keeping the existing minimal teal/black/white design direction: improve typography hierarchy, spacing, card/panel styling, and interactive states (hover/focus), and align visuals across AppShell/SidebarNav and key content cards (StatsCard, ChartBlock, ExportDataSection).
acceptanceCriteria: Sidebar header area, primary page headers, and key cards (stats/chart/export) show visibly improved spacing/typography consistency (clear hierarchy, consistent padding, balanced density).
Buttons/links have consistent hover/focus-visible states across pages, and focus styling is accessible (keyboard navigation clearly indicated).

Changes do not require editing any files under frontend/src/components/ui (Shadcn components remain unmodified); composition and styling overrides are applied from app components/pages/CSS tokens instead.

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.
Do not edit any files in frontend immutablePaths (including frontend/src/components/ui and the specified hooks/main entry points).
Do not add new backend services or external integrations; treat images as frontend static assets only.
Maintain existing routes and app shell structure (TanStack Router + AppShell).
nonGoals: Do not implement new business features (CRM logic, exports logic changes, auth changes) as part of this UI polish task.
Do not introduce third-party UI frameworks beyond the existing stack (React, Tailwind, Shadcn, React Query).
Do not perform backend schema migrations or modify Motoko storage for this request.
